file_content.text: The Reclamation Service has much more work to do on Belsavis.
The Wraith Box is reassembled, and it activated on its own. Whether it'll work again, I can't say.
I registered the power surge from here. You experienced an alien device of rejuvenation and rebirth.
We'll take it back to Dromund Kaas to study--but you may have seen it function for the last time.
The Wraith Box is yours, if you're able.
"In the final years of the reign of Ajunta Pall, five Dark Lords explored the machine--the Wraith Box."
"One burned in purple flame, another vanished from sight. Two brothers slew each other--and only one Sith returned to Korriban."
From the chronicles. Major Gart Charkron, Imperial Reclamation Service--it's an honor, my lord.
From the chronicles. Major Gart Charkron, Imperial Reclamation Service. Your arrival is fortunate.
If you're Reclamation Service archaeologists, you're not here for the Republic. You're on Belsavis to study the Rakata.
We may have similar interests.
That's right, my lord--there are strange things locked below this prison.
What are Reclamation Service archaeologists doing on Belsavis?
Tell me your purpose here.
If you don't know this planet's secrets, I'm not authorized to explain; suffice to say, there are antiquities under the prison.
I don't recognize the quotes.
The Chronicles of Lord Skaysh, one of the more obscure translations. I've found it inspiring as we explore Belsavis.
Spare me the nonsense.
My team excavated a tunnel, and an alien device of unknown purpose.
We call it the "Wraith Box," after the device from the Ajunta Pall legend. It disintegrated three of my men, but the tunnel carvings suggest it grants great power.
Your men have done enough. I will seize the Wraith Box.
Its power belongs to me.
Then adjust your mission. You're going to help me claim your Wraith Box.
I want that device, Major.
So your job is to get it working for the military.
Useful for the Empire.
Our job is research and recovery; I'd be glad to work with Intelligence.
Mystical alien devices aren't really my thing.
Sounds like superstition.
There's nothing mystical about it. Just technology we haven't mastered.
What do we know about it?
We're not sure--it radiates on a different wavelength every six seconds, and reacts to organic contact. It's at least ten thousand years old.
Your men had it coming.
I believe the device is incomplete--when the breakout started, the prisoners went scrounging for salvage. They had no idea what they had.
If the pieces can be recovered and the Wraith Box restored, the Reclamation Service would be proud to see it in the hands of a Sith.
I don't have the firepower to recover the parts, but I'm willing to make a deal: reassemble and reactivate the Wraith Box, and its power is yours.
Agreed.
Deal.
"And so the mighty descended into darkness, to seek the secrets long forgotten." Good luck.
Don't you want it?
The tunnel carvings also suggest only the strongest in body and spirit will be rewarded.
Even the Sith in the Wraith Box legend didn't all survive. But millennia later, we still remember them.
Not interested. [Refuse quest]
I respect your decision. I wish you well.
This planet is more than a prison. It is a legend. Be wary.
